service_instance_id: Unique identifier for each service instance.
product_id: Unique identifier for the product that used the service instance.
product_name: Name of the product that used the service instance.
start_date: Date when the customer started subscribing to the service instance.
is_aro: Indicates whether the service instance subscription has an automatic rollover feature, allowing it to renew or extend automatically at the end of its term.
product_lvl1: The highest category level of the product, representing the broadest classification.
product_lvl2: The second level of product categorization, providing a more specific classification within the broad category defined in level 1.
product_lvl3: The third level of product categorization, offering further specificity within the category defined in level 2.
product_lvl4: The fourth and most specific level of product categorization, detailing the exact product within the subcategory defined in level 3.
region: Region where the service instance is located.
area: Area where the service instance is located.
cluster: Cluster where the service instance is located.
latitude: Latitude coordinate of the service instance.
longitude: Longitude coordinate of the service instance.
customer_category: Represents the broader classification of customers. Examples include SKA 1, SKA 2, NA, KA, and Wholesale.
customer_sub_category: Provides further refinement within customer categories. Examples include 'SKA 1A,' 'Small National Account,' 'KA Pusat,' 'SKA 1 Regional,' and 'SKA 1B.'.
sla_total_ticket_customer: Total number of SLA Ticket that occurred due to the problem on the customer side.
sla_total_ticket: Total number of SLA Ticket that occurred due to the problem on the provider side.
sla_mttr_customer: Mean Time to Resolution of an SLA ticket that occurred due to the problem on the customer side.
sla_mttr: Mean Time to Resolution of an SLA ticket that occurred due to the problem on the provider side.
sla_sla_met: Total SLA Ticket that have been resolved.
tickets_severity_low_sum: Sum of tickets with low severity.
tickets_severity_critical_sum: Sum of tickets with critical severity.
tickets_severity_medium_sum: Sum of tickets with medium severity.
tickets_severity_high_sum: Sum of tickets with high severity.
tickets_category_non_technical_complaint: Sum of tickets categorized as non-technical complaints.
tickets_category_proactive_request_sum: Sum of tickets categorized as proactive requests.
tickets_category_request_sum: Sum of tickets categorized as general requests.
tickets_category_technical_complaint_sum: Sum of tickets categorized as technical complaints.
tickets_category_inquiry_sum: Sum of tickets categorized as inquiries.
tickets_impact_high_sum: Sum of tickets with high impact.
tickets_impact_low_sum: Sum of tickets with low impact.
tickets_impact_medium_sum: Sum of tickets with medium impact.
tickets_mttr: Mean Time to Resolution (MTTR) for tickets.
tickets_mttr_achieved: Achieved Mean Time to Resolution (MTTR) for tickets.
tickets_open_duration: Duration for which tickets remained open.
tickets_max_time_to_resolve: Maximum time taken to resolve tickets.
tickets_revenue_lost_eoc: Revenue lost due to churn (end of contract).
tickets_termination_total: Total number of ticket which service is terminated.
atm_count: Count of tickets related to Automated Teller Machines (ATMs).
sustenance_count: Count of tickets related to sustenance services.
education_count: Count of tickets related to education services.
transportation_count: Count of tickets related to transportation services.
financial_count: Count of tickets related to financial services.
healthcare_count: Count of tickets related to healthcare services.
tenure_months: Derived by subtracting the month of the 'start_date' from the month of the 'month_id_timestamp' column.
monthly_revenue: Monthly revenue generated in Indonesian Rupiah (IDR).
is_churn: Flag indicating churn status, whether the customer has churned or not on the time month_id_timestamp.
churn_propensity_score: Propensity score indicating the likelihood of churn ranging from 100-800.
churn_category: Classifies churn into categories: A, B, C, D.
churn_propensity_score_l3m: Represents the average churn propensity score over the last three months.
top_feature_1: represents the most significant predictor identified by the churn prediction model, indicating its crucial importance in understanding and forecasting customer churn behavior.
month_id_timestamp: A timestamp that includes the day, month, and year.
